DOCNAME: KONGRESNA NARODNA STRANKA AND OTHERS v. BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA
JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Carlo Ranzoni;Erik Møse;Ganna Yudkivska;Khanlar Hajiyev;Síofra O’Leary
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are ORG for ORG , and of ORG and Morals in GPE ( ORG narodna stranka zaštite ljudskih prava boraca i građana , pravde i morala PERSON i ORG ; “ the ORG “ ) and CARDINAL citizens of GPE and GPE ( “ the applicants “ ) . A list of the applicants is set out in the appendix .

CARDINAL . The applicants were granted leave by the President to be represented by the president of the ORG and CARDINAL of the applicants , Mr. PERSON ( Rule CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Rules of Court ) . The Government of GPE ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Deputy Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . The ORG was established on DATE under the laws of GPE . The applicants are members of the ORG .
CARDINAL . The ORG participated in the DATE elections for ORG of ORG of GPE . Almost all of its candidates declared themselves Bosniacs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ’s registration for the DATE elections was refused because it was submitted out of time . The ORG failed to lodge an appeal against that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ’s registration for the DATE elections was refused for failure to comply with the procedural requirements ( a failure to pay a required deposit and to submit a list of signatures in support of its candidacy ) . On DATE that decision was upheld by ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . The applicants claim that they do not declare affiliation with any of the “ constituent peoples ” ( namely , ORG , NORP and NORP ) . They describe themselves as “ a person from GPE ” , “ a NORP ” , “ a NORP ” , “ a person from GPE ” , “ a person from LOC ” , “ a person from GPE ” , “ a refugee ” , “ a war veteran ” and the like ; while CARDINAL of them describe themselves as belonging to the GPE and NORP ethnic minorities respectively .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice and international documents were outlined in ORG and Finci v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL , ECHR DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE and GPE ( no . DATE , DATE ) . Notably , the LAW of GPE makes a distinction between members of “ constituent peoples ” ( persons who declare affiliation with ORG , NORP and NORP ) and “ others ” ( members of ethnic minorities and persons who do not declare affiliation with any particular group because of intermarriage , mixed parenthood or other reasons ) .

CARDINAL . In the former ORG , a person ’s ethnic affiliation was decided solely by that person , through a system of self - classification . Thus , no objective criteria such as knowledge of a certain language or belonging to a specific religion existed . Moreover , there was no requirement of acceptance by other members of the ethnic group in question . Since the LAW contains no provisions regarding the determination of one ’s ethnicity it appears that it was assumed that the traditional self - classification would suffice .

CARDINAL . In accordance with LAW ( Articles IV § CARDINAL and V ) , only persons declaring affiliation with a “ constituent people ” are entitled to stand for election to ORG of ORG and the Presidency of GPE and GPE .
